intro: Sethia microphylla, commonly known as the small-leaved Sethia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes caraway and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or shaded areas. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
